title: [Self-Directed] Motor Skill Acquisition: Ecological Dynamics-Based Adaptive Training Program

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental understanding of exercise physiology and biomechanics
context.additional_context: Competency enhancement program for social sports instruction targeting current practitioners

learning_goals: Learners can explain core principles of the ecological dynamics framework and present three or more applicable examples for actual motor skill training.
Learners achieve over 80% performance accuracy by practicing motor skill adjustment strategies in response to fluid environmental changes through mobile learning modules.
Learners can perform individual movement pattern analysis based on formative assessment feedback and develop two or more improved technical execution plans.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
